extendedData.name: CardText
extendedData.value: Pokémon Power: Prehistoric Memory Whenever an Evolved Pokémon attacks (even if it's your opponent's), it can use any attack from its Basic Pokémon card or any Evolution card attached to it. It still has to pay for that attack's Energy cost. This power stops working while Aerodactyl is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

extendedData.name: Attack 1
extendedData.value:
[3] Fly (30)
Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Aerodactyl. If tails, this attack does nothing (not even damage).

extendedData.name: Attack 1
extendedData.value:
[1] Grab
Choose a Trainer card attached to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. Your opponent shuffles that card into his or her deck.

extendedData.name: Attack 1
extendedData.value:
[L] Attract Current (20)
Flip 3 coins. For each heads, you may search your deck for a Lightning Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Lightning Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.

extendedData.name: Attack 2
extendedData.value:
[1LLL] Gigavolt (40+)
Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage. If tails, this attack does 40 damage and the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

extendedData.name: CardText
extendedData.value:
Attach Balloon Berry to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
When the Pokémon Balloon Berry is attached to retreats, discard Balloon Berry instead of discarding Energy cards.

extendedData.name: CardText
extendedData.value: Pokémon Power: Softboiled When you play Blissey from your hand, you may flip a coin. If heads, remove 8 damage counters from Blissey. If tails, remove 4 damage counters from Blissey. Either way, if Blissey has fewer damage counters than that, remove all of them.

extendedData.name: Attack 1
extendedData.value:
[4] Body Slam (30)
Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

extendedData.name: CardText
extendedData.value: Pokémon Power: Time Travel If an opponent's attack would Knock Out Celebi, flip a coin. If heads, Celebi isn't Knocked Out and you shuffle it and all cards attached to it into your deck. This power doesn't work if Celebi is already Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

extendedData.name: Attack 1
extendedData.value:
[P] Psychic Damage
Flip 3 coins. For each heads, put 1 damage counter on the Defending Pokémon.

extendedData.name: Attack 1
extendedData.value:
[GG] Psychic Leaf (10+)
Flip a coin for each Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each heads. Remove a number of damage counters from Celebi equal to the damage done to the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance). If Celebi has fewer damage counters than that, remove all of them.

extendedData.name: Attack 1
extendedData.value:
[L] Positive Ion (10+)
Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage. If tails, this attack does 10 damage.

extendedData.name: Attack 2
extendedData.value:
[W] Negative Ion (10)
If the Defending Pokémon attacks Chinchou during your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Chinchou is reduced by 10 (before applying Weakness and Resistance). (Benching or evolving either Pokémon ends this effect.)

extendedData.name: Attack 1
extendedData.value:
[G] Triggered Poison (20)
If your opponent attaches an Energy card to the Defending Pokémon during his or her next turn, that Pokémon becomes Poisoned.

extendedData.name: Attack 2
extendedData.value:
[1GG] Cross Attack (20x)
Flip 4 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads. If you get 2 or more heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

extendedData.name: Attack 1
extendedData.value:
[2] Present
Flip 3 coins. If exactly 1 is heads, this attack does 40 damage. If exactly 2 are heads, remove 3 damage counters from the Defending Pokémon. If the Defending Pokémon has fewer damage counters than that, remove all of them. If all 3 are heads, this attack does 60 damage. If all 3 are tails, remove all damage counters from the Defending Pokémon.

extendedData.name: CardText
extendedData.value: Pokémon Power: Howl When you play Entei from your hand, you may discard the top 5 cards of your deck. (If you have fewer cards in your deck than that, discard all of them.) If any of those are Fire Energy cards, attach them to any of your Fire Pokémon of your choice. Using this power ends your turn.

extendedData.name: Attack 1
extendedData.value:
[RRR] Searing Flames (60)
Discard 2 Fire Energy cards attached to Entei or this attack does nothing.

extendedData.name: CardText
extendedData.value: Pokémon Power: Legendary Body As long as Entei is your Active Pokémon, Entei and Energy cards attached to it aren't affected by effects from Trainer cards other than Stadium cards. As long as this Power is active, discard any Trainer cards attached to Entei. (This power works even if Entei is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.)

extendedData.name: Attack 1
extendedData.value:
[RRR] Mega Flame (50)
Flip 2 coins. For each tails, discard 1 Fire Energy card from Entei, if it has any.

extendedData.name: Attack 2
extendedData.value:
[3] Leek Jab (40)
This attack can't be used during your next turn. (Benching Farfetch'd ends this effect.)

extendedData.name: Attack 2
extendedData.value:
[2L] Tail Shock (30)
Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

extendedData.name: Attack 1
extendedData.value:
[1] Screech
Until the end of your next turn, if an attack damages the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance), that attack does 20 more damage to the Defending Pokémon.

extendedData.name: Attack 2
extendedData.value:
[1G] Poison Bite (10)
If this attack damages the Defending Pokémon, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned and you remove a number of damage counters from Golbat equal to half that damage (rounded up to the nearest 10). If Golbat has fewer damage counters than that, remove all of them. Either way, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

extendedData.name: Attack 1
extendedData.value:
[1] Fin Smack (10x)
Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

extendedData.name: Attack 1
extendedData.value:

Does 10 damage to each of your own Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

extendedData.name: CardText
extendedData.value:
This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play.
Once during each player's turn, he or she may flip a coin. If heads, that player removes 2 damage counters from his or her Active Pokémon (1 if it only has 1).

extendedData.name: Attack 2
extendedData.value:

extendedData.value:

Choose any number of your Hoppips and Skiplooms. Then, for each Pokémon you chose in this way, you may search your deck for a card that evolves from that Pokémon and attach it to that Pokémon. (This counts as evolving those Pokémon.) Shuffle your deck afterward.

[2WW] Twister (50)
Flip 2 coins. For each heads, choose an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon, if any, and discard it. If both are tails, this attack does nothing (not even damage).

extendedData.name: CardText
extendedData.value: Pokémon Power: Submerge Once during your turn (before your attack), you may change Lanturn's type to Water until the end of your turn. This power can't be used if Lanturn is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed. If Lanturn becomes Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed after you have used this power, its type changes back to Lightning.

extendedData.name: CardText
extendedData.value: Pokémon Power: Magma Pool If Magcargo is your Active Pokémon and moves to the Bench, remove 1 Fire Energy card attached to Magcargo, if any, and attach it to the new Active Pokémon. (You can't choose an Energy card that you used to pay the Retreat Cost.)

extendedData.name: Attack 1
extendedData.value:
[RRR] Lava Flow (40+)
You may discard any number of Fire Energy cards attached to Magcargo when you use this attack. If you do, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage for each Fire Energy card you discarded in this way.

extendedData.name: CardText
extendedData.value:
Pokémon Power: Electromagnetic Power
As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may take 1 Energy card attached to 1 of your Magnemites, Magnetons, or Dark Magnetons and attach it to a different 1 of your Magnemites, Magnetons, or Dark Magnetons. This power can't be used if Magneton is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

extendedData.name: CardText

If Porygon2 becomes Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed, the Energy card goes back to its original type.

results.cleanName: Neo Revelation Booster Pack Unlimited Edition

extendedData.name: CardText
extendedData.value: This booster pack contains 11 cards for Wizards of the Coast printed Neo Revelation set.

results.name: Neo Revelation Booster Pack [Unlimited Edition]

extendedData.name: CardText
extendedData.value:
THE LEGEND AWAKENS
From beneath a fire-ravaged tower, three ancient and powerful Pokémon emerge. The journey of worldwide adventure continues with the revelation of these legendary Pokémon.
This display box contains
 36 booster packs, each with 11 game cards
